page.description: Converts a date string to an RFC 850 formatted date (Weekday, dd-Mon-yy hh:mm:ss TIMEZONE)

prototypes.prototype: Formatted_Date_Time as C = A5_RFC850DATE( Character_Date_Time as C )

argument.name: Formatted_Date_Time
argument.description: A date time value in the format: "Weekday, dd-Mon-yy hh:mm:ss GMT" ("Tuesday, 30-Mar-04 14:17:02 GMT")

argument.name: Character_Date_Time
argument.description: A date time value formatted "mm/dd/yyyy 0h:0m:0s am".

page.discussion: The A5_RFC850DATE() function takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string following the RFC 850 format.
page.example: dim t as T t = now() ? a5_rfc850date(t) = "Tuesday, 30 Mar 04 16:17:55 GMT"
